intro: Fagara mawambensis, commonly known as the Mawambé tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the tropical rainforests of Central and East Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can grow up to 15 meters in height, characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that turn from green to yellow when mature, containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense forest ecosystems. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation projects.
